website_summaries.verdict: If you prefer Garmin and a slim design when it comes to fitness trackers, chances are the feature-packed vivosmart 4 won't disappoint.
pros: Minimalist structure isn't bulky and looks attractive
Measures blood oxygen levels and heart rate along with numerous activity metrics to keep you motivated
cons: Some inaccuracies reported, such as registering more hours of sleep than users actually get

customer_reviews.title: HR monitor is ridiculously inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews, but I'm so disappointed in this product I thought I would share my experience. I primarily bought this for monitoring my heart rate during workouts. During the day when I'm not tracking exercise the HR monitor seems OK, but once I start an exercise the HR monitor is very inaccurate. During an intense workout where I'm short of breath and sweating (and probably between 150 and 180 bpm), the HR monitor says I'm between 60 and 90 bpm. Display and band are very small and difficult to use or put on if you have bigger fingers. Overall, I'm very disappointed in this product and will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Sassycat2

customer_reviews.title: Good concept, but poorly made product
customer_reviews.text: O2 sensor won't work propertly, even with full battery, sleep tracker changes throughout the day, after working out (running) continue track the rest of your day as a run due to increased heart rate. The only thing that work propertly is a heart rate monitor, almost as accurate as the chest strap. Returning, will go back to Fitbit
customer_reviews.author: Moose

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good device with a couple of shortcomings
customer_reviews.text: My wife really enjoyed this birthday present. She loves the color, the size, and the overall function. The biggest problem is that there's some sort of allergic reaction to what's in the buckle. It would be nice if they could use a nonmetal Buckle or one that's truly hypogenic.
customer_reviews.author: Darrin B. Roush

customer_reviews.title: Only worked for 10 mins
customer_reviews.text: Got it out of the box, downloaded the app, got set up then the home screen stopped working. It would not wake up when tapped or with wrist movement. It would wake up and tell me I had a call or text but nothing else. I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Leann W.

customer_reviews.title: Oxygenation wildly inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: COVID WARNING! DO NOT BUY THIS! If you are thinking about purchasing this watch for oxygen monitoring during Covid think again! I got sick 4/1, received the watch on 4/4. It steadily said my oxygenation was 95% - 97%. On 4/7, I woke up at 1:30am and went to the ER. All the while my watch said I was oxygenating at 95%. Got to the ER, was 88%, next thing I know I’m waking up 8 days later from a ventilator. Please do not purchase this!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Leonardi

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love this
customer_reviews.text: I will say I wanted to love this. I have owned 2 other garmin watches. Including the original vivosmart so I really wanted to love this but I don’t Pros: Lightweight Cute Multi sport Oxygen Stress levels Hr Cons: Short battery life Touch screen doesn’t work well No bike option in activities I am on my 2nd in two months due to being so buggy Doesn’t track steps accurately Long actives (over an hour) it doesn’t track time or steps accurately No power off button
customer_reviews.author: JLG

customer_reviews.title: I love the Vivosmart, but CAUTION when buying it here on Amazon.  This is a short band.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Vivo Smart 4 but the band was too short for my wrist, and this band is NOT replaceable. Called Garmin, and found out they make a larger wristband. Returned this Vivo Smart and purchased the larger/longer band from here:  Amazon should put this larger band as an option on this smaller band page so that customers know it exists. Then it will show the choice of colors and choice of band sizes. Will submit a review on the larger band page, but in summary, this VivoSmart is very good and recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Nice slim profile
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as it was rated by Consumer reports as being accurate in measuring heart rate. I have found this to be true for the most part. It’s inconsistent in alerting me when my heart rate is elevated even though it’s set up to do so. Very accurate in recording steps and stairs climbed, but the calorie counts are not reliable. Ok value for the price-comfortable to wear and I like the slim profile as I have small wrists. It has too many feature for me which sometimes make it hard to get to the screen I want.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Expected better
customer_reviews.text: I have now had this for just over 6 months. I think I could have achieved the same with a generic $20 band. It tracks steps/activity okay. The sleep tracking is not accurate. If this is an important feature for you, this is not the device for you. Additionally I am very disappointed that the rose gold portion of the face is gone, just gone - SEE PICTURE. I am not aggressively active and fully expect a brand name product of this level to not fall apart. Where the rose gold used to be, now there is a crevice that collects stuff in it.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey

customer_reviews.title: Cute and able to turn off Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered a Fitbit but returned it because there was no way to turn the Bluetooth off. Thank you garmin for creating a great product with health and safety in mind
customer_reviews.author: Rose Moon

customer_reviews.title: O2 sensor sleep
customer_reviews.text: I like that it has o2 sensor during sleep it helped me to diagnose my apnea different faces to choose from I use the one shows temperature outside and has body battery which has helped me since I have so many health issues
customer_reviews.author: Danny V.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love. I love the mobile app and all the stats! It has helped me recognize how stressed I was at work. I have since taken steps to relax and can see how my stress level has decreased as well. I love the badges it gives you for random achievements. I love how it makes me want to be more active. I think the stats are very accurate and I've previously had bad luck with heart rate monitors. I've even purchased other fitness monitors and returned them. But, I am totally in love with this one!! I am buying one for my significant other right now!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle B

customer_reviews.title: Love this watch - no replacement bands
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Garmin watch, have had this for about 18 months. Have loved it until now. There are no replacement bands available. Considering that it is an activity watch that is intended to get beat up day to day- I would not purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Ripp K

customer_reviews.title: You can't pair it without an update.
customer_reviews.text: My vivosmart 4 would not pair with the Garmin connect app. I spent an entire afternoon trying and retrying. I called garmin support. The gentleman that I spoke with said that there is an update for that watch. I should connect my watch to the computer, let him take control of my computer and he would send the update straight to my watch. It would fix my problem AND would only cost me $49.95! I bought two of these watches! $100.00 additional cost just to make them work. They are on their way back to Amazon as we speak. Thank you Amazon for having such an effective easy return policy. I'm very disappointed in Garmin!
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: If you work hard, look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Total garbage. Thinks my heartrate is 90 while I sit on the couch watching TV and 75 when I do a fairly vigorous 20 minute row. Touchscreen is insanely non-responsive and you basically have to smash the screen with your finger to get it to respond. Menu button basically doesn't work. Full of features I don't care one bit about and that have dubious scientific merit when measured by a wrist device (Pulse Ox? don't care). Perfect if you're about showing off to your friends the minimum amount of effort you put in to get some goals and some badges. But if you actually are serious about health, put this in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolute JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: I initially thought this would be a good fitness tracker. However, the accuracy is terrible! It seems like it's worst when you need it the most. Doesn't track steps or walks or calories with any degree of consistent accuracy! I've done everything recommended - resets, having bluetooth on always (shouldn't have to - but still tried). ZERO help from customer service! Calls and emails never once returned! HIGHLY - NOT RECOMMENDED! I even attempted to go thru Amazon to return - but they weren't helpful either! I wasted my $$$ on this piece of junk and now can't return it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevog

customer_reviews.title: Newer Version but Vewer Features
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed with the direction Garmin and other manufacturers are going with health trackers. Number one complaint is the bands are no longer replaceable. So, if or should I say when the band breaks you will need to buy a whole new tracker. Although the new displays are easier to read, they have also removed helpful features like date and time. Unless you buy the super large and expensive models. I want a health tracker not a wearable computer/watch/tv/health tracker that's larger than a standard watch.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Z

customer_reviews.title: Waiting for revival of Garmin
customer_reviews.text: The Garmin Vivosmart 4 worked perfectly for six weeks. Then, syncing problems started... Until its demise, the Vivosmart 4 won my praise every day. I could blame the recent updates to Apple’s iOS; or, I could surmise on the Garmin app. It hardly matters. Instead, I must don my engineer’s uniform and attempt to resolve the matter with Garmin’s tech support. Of course, I can return the Vivosmart 4 to Garmin for repair or replacement. But, the ongoing problem of syncing on three Garmin products to date reveals a significant problem to Garmin customers. For me, the Vivosmart 4 is my last Garmin watch. Buyers BEWARE
customer_reviews.author: G. Tomer

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy
customer_reviews.text: I Bought this one because I have a small wrist, 5.5”, and it appeared to be the smallest profile of activity trackers. It has plenty of holes in band but half of Band is stiff so can’t really tighten around wrist appropriately so this is disappointing. Double tap to activate does Not work, have to tap 4-6 times so this is frustrating. Did Not think wrist movement worked to activate but found online that I needed to deactivate do not disturb feature so that works now. Would not have bought if I could have tried it on And tried it out. This is my first activity tracker so maybe I had too high expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Scroggin

customer_reviews.title: This is the smaller size. The band is not replaceable.
customer_reviews.text: Although it is not noted anywhere, this page is for the version with the smaller band which does not fit me. I will return it but I will not order the larger size because I discovered the band cannot be replaced. My experience with such plastic bands is that they last about six months at which point this item will be junk,. A weird design decision that will create lots of unhappy customers unlikely ever to return.
customer_reviews.author: StoneTrouble

customer_reviews.title: REturn
customer_reviews.text: I did not like this item too small, want a watch with date , and time showing.....I returned the watch to the Las Vegas fulfillmentcenter.. My husband had gotten the watch for me ..I sent a note to Please return his money through his bank acct of which I supplied a listing or if You can exchange the watch for a bigger face with time and date showing all the time and the hidden icons for steps, heart rate , I DO NOT NEED all the exercise features I am 78 yrs old.. Please Help I need a watch..Please contact me...... I am an Old customer of Amazon Sandra Maher slw1942@yahoo.com
customer_reviews.author: Sandra L Warden

customer_reviews.title: Parts fall in 7 months
customer_reviews.text: Its a good activity tracker while it works, It worked fine for the first 7 months then ring around the screen fell off and got lost about the same time it started counted between 5 to 10 times more floors. No cleaning fixed the floor counting problem. No way to replace any part so I am stuck till I get another tracker. Pros: 1- Step counting is accurate. 2- Floor counting was accurate for the first 7 month. 3- Heart rate measurement is mostly accurate. Cons: 1- Floor counting counted multiple floors when just moving normally after 7 month. 2- Auto activity detector didnt work for swimming.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A very sexist device.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very beautiful tracker, I got the gray and rose gold because it matches my ring. Sadly, it doesnt count my steps while I push a stroller and since people seem to frown upon you leaving your infant at home to encourage independence it is somewhat useless to me. But it is very pretty. Appreantly, it is common knowledge among fit people that steps do not register when you push a stroller but because I am not a fit person I did not know this. I just wanted to warn all the non fit mothers out there about this sexist yet pretty device. Back to my life as a handmaid.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bellamy

customer_reviews.title: Surprising feature
customer_reviews.text: I had searched for somethign like this for a while - there are a lot of other brands out there with similar features but the O2 sensor swaed me this way evern though it does eat into the batter life with it on while you are sleeping. What was great with my iOS iPhone is with the Garmin Connect app runnign in the back end, I get all of my notifications on my wrist! With the bright display, it's super easy to see, read and feel the vibraiton when you get a message, calendar reminder, Amazon notificaiton etc! This has been a huge and wonderful feature I didn't even know I wanted! Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Gene Denmark

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tracker, specifically for the pulse ox feature and it has ever worked all the way through the night. Now, it turns on at 8:00pm and off at 12:00am. At least that it somewhat consistent, although not 100%. It also automatically goes into do not disturb mode at 12:00pm and back to normal at 12:00am. I’ve deleted it in the app and loaded it back, no difference. I’ve had it since December and I’m out. Off to buy one that works like it’s supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Loo

customer_reviews.title: Good if you have internet always.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for three weeks. My time has included a very active vacation. I like the device itself but the software in the device and on my phone is very primitive. I wish there was a way to write my own code for it. It has what I need I just can’t get it to display in a usable format. Most of the interesting features like graphs on your phone are unavailable without internet. If you are always in Internet you won’t notice but you have to wait to get into internet to get any activity or sleep charts. It seems like the phone should be able to process at least some of this without the internet.
customer_reviews.author: CSK

customer_reviews.title: Beware Android Users
customer_reviews.text: I loved this watch when I first got it. It was super cute, and had a nice slim fit, but I eventually learned it was not a great product. This watch will not stay connected to my Android phone, therefore it does not back up or sync any of the data that I have created day to day. The process to get it re-connected is super annoying, and usually involves the Garmin help line. When I contacted Garmin for a refund, they let me know that they DO NOT provide refunds for any of their products, if purchased through Amazon, even if it is defective. Just an FYI if you are an Android user, looking to purchase this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Ludholtz

customer_reviews.title: Screen flashing
customer_reviews.text: Received on Sunday, returned on Thursday. First Garmin product that has failed. Tech support was polite, but having been on that end of the phone in IT, I could clearly understand it was the consumer's fault, not the products, even when I explained the problem was constantly occurring whether it was stationary on my desk or actually on the wrist. The face features never were stable enough to make contact with any of the icons. Received on Sunday, Returned on Thursday.
customer_reviews.author: Bob M

customer_reviews.title: Works in the pool for aqua aerobics!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th Vivosmart or Vivofit I've purchased. I have loved each one, but each only lasted a few years and it was time to get a new one. Each one is better than the last one and has more features. The important thing for me is that I can wear it for an hour or more in a pool or water and have no damage and still have it functioning. Not all fitness devices can do this.
customer_reviews.author: teacher mom

customer_reviews.title: Band is ripping
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed this watch, do I think it was completely accurate? No, but it did help me want to get up and move more. I mainly got this because of turning bluetooth on/off, for some reason I get weird pain in my arm wearing other brands. This does not do that to me. However, now exactly a year later my band is ripping. Highly disappointed especially since you get change them out. Yes, I knew this before buying but I figured it was going to last me more then a year.
customer_reviews.author: FishyBrittyKitty

customer_reviews.title: Love my Vivosmart 4
customer_reviews.text: I moved away from my Fitbit to the VIvosmart 4 on the recommendation of a friend. I couldn't be happier! I haven't figured out all the things that it can track. I used it for a walk and checked it against the App, "May My Walk" There was only a 6 step difference. I have to laugh when I am driving up a hill and I get congratulated for climbing up a flight of stairs. And, I haven't figured out how to track my bicycle rides. I love the reminders to relax and breath. The added details for deep sleep, light sleep, Rem sleep and awake have been very insightful. The features do not disappoint. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Great, slick device, could use few improvements
customer_reviews.text: Overall great product. Love that it's so compact on female wrist, unlike many other very bulky devices. Stikl, even though screen is not large, screen is responsive and easy to to navigate. Downsides: - Cannot replace bands (a feature I liked in other tracker devices: when broken or to dress it up to match outfits) - when in night time do not disturb mode, cannot check the time. I was surpu at this, as I want to have option that notification are silenced, but if I wake up "middle of the night" need to know the time.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia A Pashkova

customer_reviews.title: I'm very satisfied with the product and Garmun's customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I'm at 76 year old woman and I wanted this product to track steps, strenuous activity, heart rate and sleep. Even when I'm huffing and puffing and my heart rate reads 120, it says I'm not doing strenuous activity. I think this needs to be adjusted. I'm also not tech savvy and had trouble - I called and your customer service rep was great! He was very patient and walked me through it step by step. I'm enjoying stepping into the 21st century.
customer_reviews.author: Ginny Bremer

customer_reviews.title: Have to charge every few days.
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so I got this from my husband for Christmas and I love it! I like that it tracks everything!!! I do wish the battery lasted longer than 5 days... but when charging only takes like 2hrs. I always just put it on to charge while I'm in the shower or early morning when I'm having coffee while the kids sleep. Fast charging!!! I loved it so much I bought my husband one about 4 days ago.
customer_reviews.author: Heather W.

customer_reviews.title: Pulse Ox is inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to measure my pulse Ox at night. The feature does not work. You have to keep your wrist completely motionless to get a measure. It takes 2 minutes to get a result. The result is completely inaccurate. It varied from 83% to 97% on consecutive readings, while my fingertip monitor displayed a constant 96%.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick Gorman

customer_reviews.title: Good but not very robust
customer_reviews.text: I really like the tracker, it is small, unintrusive, fairly accurate. Garmin has put a lot of technology into this little gadget. However, I will say it is not very lifeproof. I work as a maintenance technician and so I use my hands a lot. After 3 days of wearing the tracker, the screen glass is scratched is several places and the bezel is dinged up pretty badly. I am happy with the features, but not very happy with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ray G.Top Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: PulseOx
customer_reviews.text: I bought it specifically for the PulseOx ability while sleeping, they removed the ability after purchase
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne

customer_reviews.title: Mostly like it
customer_reviews.text: This Garmin watch does what I want - shows me the time even legible outdoors in the sunlight and counts my steps. That's ALL that I want. It took me about a week to learn enough about it to get rid of all the excess STUFF that kept showing up that I didn't need. Now I've got it the way I like it. It doesn't stay synced to my phone app, though. There is a weather app that I can't seem to remove. It constantly tells me to re-sync. Even 5 minutes after I've just synced and have not moved away from my phone. That seems bogus.
customer_reviews.author: B. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tracker. Lousy GPS Software.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the slim design of this unit and its features. It worked great for several months, but then the GPS stopped working due to a software issue. This negates much of the outdoor fitness functionality for walking, running, cycling, hiking, etc. I've been trying to work with customer support for several weeks now, but so far "the engineers are aware of the problem and we'll get back to you as soon as we find a solution". I'll update my review if the situation changes. But since my wife and daughter's Fitbit Charge 4's are flawless, I will be heading in that direction.
customer_reviews.author: Alison L White

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had stuck with Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: I got the garmin after having a Fitbit (it was cheaper and waterproof and had a yoga setting)and I’m going back to the Fitbit. I feel terrible about wasting the money but it’s just not measuring up. The app doesn’t track a lot of things that I liked in Fitbit like food intake, calories burned and sleep and I don’t know which one is right or wrong but the Garmin doesn’t give me as many steps as the Fitbit or as many calories burned so it’s really demoralizing for me! Good quality- no glitches or anything but just not as good on the app side.
customer_reviews.author: Rae Buckley

customer_reviews.title: Better than Fitbit, Reliable and consistent
customer_reviews.text: After 3 years my old fitbit gave up the ghost. The most frustrating piece being sync with phone via bluetooth. My wife continued down the path getting a newer Fitbit while I chose this Garmin Model. Boy am I happy I did! My wife has been plagued with sync issues while mine has purred like a kitten with the only issue being the quality of the band which disintegrated after 3 months. Overall this has been a solid performer
customer_reviews.author: Digital Nomad IL

customer_reviews.title: One of the best trackers
customer_reviews.text: This tracker tells so much that I am still learning how to use it. The small size is perfect for a small wrist. I have nothing to compare it to, but is seems to be accurate to my Fitbit that died recently
customer_reviews.author: Linda-chicky

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: I really like the looks and fit of this watch. The app was fairly easy to use too. I just didn’t think the heart rate monitor worked very well. Even while running, it never measured by heart rate above 80 even when my treadmill measured if 130+. Also, the distance walked and calorie burn seemed extremely low. Even on days that I worked out for 2 hours it measured my total calories burned at just over my BMR. Maybe mine was not calibrated well. I really hoped it would work better because the functions, look, and feel were exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Great Costumer Service!
customer_reviews.text: This tracker is good on price, app is fine no much complaints. Software part no problem occurred for now, just get around a weeks so. The hardware is problem, I have the screen ring is come out during the swimming, It looks like glue is failing apart. There is no replacement for the Vivosmart 4 screen ring replace. So I have call costumer service department, they are very nice and patient with me. They’re listened my problem and immediately provided solution for me. They are able to switch a new one for me after I send my broke one. This sounds very good! Great costumer service. I will support Garmin as always. Thank you!!!
customer_reviews.author: Min

customer_reviews.title: Great fitness device,just not for me
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning the Garmin but it wasn't because the product was bad. I returned it because i ended up liking my FitBit device more. I thought i might like the switch to Garmin, but I have grown to accustom to the Fitbit lifestyle. I really liked that this device was more compact that my Fitbit Charge 3, but I disliked the fixed band. The smaller size is really all I liked over my FitBit. I'm sure a lot of people will prefer the Garmin, just not my cup of tea. Still 5 stars for product quality, size, and app.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Garmin, you can do better
customer_reviews.text: The app is always (at least weekly, sometimes more) having server connection issues. I have to reset my device and unpair from the app to fix the non server related issues. I still can’t get the intensity minutes to show on the main summary screen despite having it selected. February 23-I’d really like to go more then 3 days in a row with a functioning item. Now the intensity minutes have magically appeared but haven’t updated with my last two work outs. My sleep and steps are no longer appearing despite being selected as visible under “edit my day”.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have one and they work great! During my pregnancy I have some problems with my heart rate. This watches helps me to control myself. They show, when I have to breath, how many oxygen I have in blood during my sleeping time. And, what I like the most-they are not bulky, I almost don’t feel them, and they cost less than iWatches. This were bought to a friend as a birthday gift. He is happy with that
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Metal display frame fell of for the second time
customer_reviews.text: I got the Vivosmart 4 replaced half a year ago and as with the first, the metal display frame suddenly fell off. According to Garmin the newer charges should have this problem fixed, so be aware what you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Andreas Klein

customer_reviews.title: Love this watch!
customer_reviews.text: Love that it is so slim and comfortable that I can't feel it on my wrist as I was concerned that I wouldn't want to wear it while sleeping. I also really appreciate that it wakes me up early by vibrating without disturbing my husband. And the only time I have to take it off is to charge it as I can wear it while I shower. All the other things it does are just gravy. Love this watch!!!!
customer_reviews.author: C. J. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Might have been the perfect tracker, who knows
customer_reviews.text: I researched long and hard for the perfect fitness tracker. This may have been it — it’s certainly the right size, is pretty, and allegedly has many great functions. But, I was never able to get it paired and set up. I followed the microscopically small printed directions and tried every hack I could find online, but no joy. In the return process (very easy, thanks Amazon), Amazon even offered technical assistance. However, I figured anything that mysterious to master wasn’t going to be long-term user friendly. Too many years using Apple products, I guess, and I’ve gotten used to slick and easy startups. Two stars for beauty and petite size.
customer_reviews.author: B. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Great Fitness Band!
customer_reviews.text: I switched back to Garmin after having a Samsung Gear Fit for about 18 months. This is a great fitness band that seems to accurately track steps, sleep, exercise, heart rate, and more. It has a battery life of 3+ days and I love the slim design. It's perfect for small wrists. If I had one complaint, it would be that there is no battery percentage shown on the watch or in the app. It has a small battery icon that shows the battery level, but it doesn't give a percentage. I highly recommend this band.
customer_reviews.author: _iCarrie_

customer_reviews.title: Support lacking
customer_reviews.text: Device installed fine, paired fine. Contacted Chat, had trouble monitoring an activity but couldn't find serial number and had to return later. Later, chat is no longer with us. After twenty minutes of "retrieving configuration" I assumed the worst. Will do it the old fashioned way, through the mail. Love the app and statistics. Would like to use them all.
customer_reviews.author: beauchamp43

customer_reviews.title: Garmin is good.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. Garmin app is the best. I think it counts more steps than I take but its pretty close I think. Very accurate HR monitor and o2 sensor is good too. Battery life is pretty good, about a week of use. However, I bought the MI band 4 for my kids and I think I like it better. The app is pretty good and the device has a color screen and the cost is about 1/3 of this unit. I thought I needed the Garmin name, but I would not be dissapointed if all I could afford was the MI band 4.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Boeck

customer_reviews.title: Great watch - allergic to metal buckle
customer_reviews.text: I really, really like this watch. I like the size, the shape, the color, the features. It has improved my awareness of my sleep and activity. But, I am SO allergic to the metal on the wristband with a raised bumpy, itchy rash. I really, really wish that if they had spent so much excellent time on the features, that they would have maybe found a way for it to be a little less skin reactive - or invented some kind of buckle cover to protect skin. I like it so much, it's still 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Katarina

customer_reviews.title: Great health and fitness tool
customer_reviews.text: Really like the fitness and sleep features. Doesn’t stay properly connected to my iPhone to receive weather and messages all the time, but everything transmits from the Vivismart to the app perfectly. Love the stress and get up and move reminders. It fits very comfortably for sleep wear.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Very useful device for today’s world in a small beautiful package!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I loved the look of it and wanted a device to measure my blood oxygen. You have to really sit down and learn to use it. I’m not techy and it took me a few hours. But it’s seem acuate , it does many things I need ,holds it charge for many day, depending on the amount you use it for. It is sensitive, you need to be patient and learn to use it and be willing to go back and recheck your learning . But as I said, I’m NOT technically sauve and with patience, it got it! And I love it!!! Also have had many people compliment on it. I wear it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working correctly after first week
customer_reviews.text: I had a garmin fitness tracker before that I loved, but I broke the band and decided to purchase this one. Loved it for the first week. Had everything I was looking for and worked well for my purposes. After one week, the battery died. I charged it up and the step counter stopped working. Spent 45 minutes with online Garmin support, who were great at trying to help me. They ended up telling me it was defective and they couldn't help. Totally bummed about that.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen K

customer_reviews.title: Nice form factor, but flaws in usability.
customer_reviews.text: Would be the best compact fitness tracker of them all.... if it had an actual, physical button or two on the sides. Taps often fail to register when trying to stop a run or other workout, or trying to turn off an alarm. Also, interface could be more user friendly and insightful. While it tracks much more metrics than my Fitbit Alta HR did, I find the information less useful/understandable/relatable, etc.... so, you have all this data, tell me what it means. Could also use more options on notifications. Need to be able to turn off notifications for emails, but turn them on for calendar notifications in outlook, etc...
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Carton

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.text: My main complaint is the band being garbage. I've had it two months and it snapped in two places, and I don't even do vigorous activity. Way too expensive for something that's gonna snap so easily and be rendered useless. Also, as many others have said, the heart rate monitor isn't accurate. I've had a very obvious high pulse and it says I'm sitting at a low stress level with a normal pulse. There are times it's telling me to relax when I'm about as relaxed as I can be. It also records steps when I'm not moving.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Use & Very Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and has all the tracking devices you need in a beautiful compact face. Switched from FitBit to this Garmen and I love it!
customer_reviews.author: B. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: A con that I can say is that I wish it came with a screen protector. Had I known, I would have purchased one at the same time. Also, it would be so much better if when I can't get up to walk (like when driving) it would remind me later instead of the alert turning off. It is great to start understanding why I feel like I do during the day because of my sleep patterns & my activity the day before. I could go on & on about everything I like about the Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: Denise S

customer_reviews.title: not reliable
customer_reviews.text: I order this on March 23rd 2019, it just died without any warning when it has been fully charged while I swam today, when I try to plugged it in to charge, no display came on and the devise became very hot. I had other Garmin trackers previously and they are all still functioning when I upgrade to the vivosmart 4. This is really disappointing. I hope I can get a replacement. I am happy to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: juju girl

customer_reviews.title: All around a great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a fabulous product! I like it better than FitBit. I have a ZTE ZMax Pro phone from Metro PCS & red that Fitbit app will not work with my phone (also Fitbit recent update has caused many regular users to be unable to use their device). I found Garmin does everything I wanted & more. Takes a little navigating when you first get it but after you understand the menus it's easy-peasy. Battery life is good. No issues at all with app or device. All around a great product
customer_reviews.author: Courtney G. Robb

customer_reviews.title: Hoping to love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m on the fence and will update if my replacement is better. It keeps saying I’m having an irregular heart rate when nothing is going on at all. It does give some interesting info on sleep. Hard to say if it’s accurate or not..how could one tell?! So far I like it, other than it going crazy about my heart rate. Will update once I get my replacement and see if it is just a glitch for this particular one. I also love the stress monitoring.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Gleason

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says!
customer_reviews.text: The one reason I bought tracker is that it had an oxygen monitor. As someone with breathing issues I was so impressed by the accuracy. It’s really pretty accurate as I’ve used the oximeter to see how close and very seldom is it off! It’s easy to use and connect to the app!
customer_reviews.author: Kalyn

customer_reviews.title: Great tool. 8/10. Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: The battery lasts about 4 days, without the pulse ox or phone connection active. Wish it was longer, but oh well. The app is great and I can connect that with my nutrition apps to compound my weight loss. The floor counter might be a bit off, but the steps counter is great. You can customize a lot of things on the app, like the watch widgets and your calorie preferences or goals. It even tracks your shoes. Overall I'd give it a solid 8/10.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian Brown

customer_reviews.title: Stops Syncing Every Other Week
customer_reviews.text: I initially liked this, my first ever, fitness tracker. However, it stops syncing randomly and won’t track my sleep or my activities. The main reasons I bought the thing in the first place. I’ve already had to reset it to the factory setting to get it to start re-syncing. It’s now on its second time in less than a month where I may have to do that again. Annoying to say the least. The band also irritates my wrist. There has to be a better value option out there. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith L Metzler

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This tracker has helped me figure out why I have been waking up tired the last two weeks. I have been wearing it to bed the last week, I had no idea that my stress level is extremely high while I sleep. This tracker also tells you to take a breath when your heart rate rises.
customer_reviews.author: AnnMarie

customer_reviews.title: Activity tracking is worthless.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pretty neat with pulseox tracking. HR seems accurate. The activity tracking is trash. Half the time it just stops tracking, and it is very hard to even use the menus. The touchscreen is terrible, not sensitive at all. You have to tap it like 10 times to wake it up. Go elsewhere unless you want the pulseox!
customer_reviews.author: OMG Guy

customer_reviews.title: Best fitness tracker I've owned!
customer_reviews.text: works great for tracking lots of information. I especially like the sleep, heart rate and stress monitoring features. Keeps very accurate for my steps and knows when I am doing my treadmill at the gym. Charge lasts about 4 to 5 days depending on how active you are. App for the smart phone gives you a great view of everything. Very nice device!!!
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: The unit does not hold a charge...  not really impressed!
customer_reviews.text: The battery does not stay charged... worked fine for a few weeks... Charged and would track for 4-5 days. Now I don’t get a day... Cleaned it as instructed with alcohol... Full charge... same problem... not even 12 hours. Yes checked all the functions... nothing else is running to drain the battery...
customer_reviews.author: Robert R Plank

customer_reviews.title: Switched from Fitbit to Garmin
customer_reviews.text: The band is so soft and flexible and it has a fairly low profile for a fitness tracker. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Love the small size, wish it could connect more seamlessly to 3rd party apps
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a smaller watch for my wrist that had great features and this definitely fits the bill! I love the gray/rose gold color as it goes with any outfit. I am also using the weight watchers program and I wish that Garmin could sync more seamlessly with the WW app but I haven't found a good way to do this yet. For the price point I am very pleased as it gives me the stats I really care about (with a few extra bells and whistles).
customer_reviews.author: Happy Mama B

customer_reviews.title: Love my Garmin
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something to track my daily steps, but the perk of having the other tools as we has been a perk. It’s very comfortable to wear, and the thin band and slim profile make you forget you’re wearing it. The app is pretty good, although a little difficult to navigate in if you want to go past your daily information. Also, it’s slow to sync to your device. I’m unsure if he accuracy, but I feel it rounds up a bit more. And I wish you could choose you’re reminder for movement alerts, but you can not.
customer_reviews.author: Beebot1

customer_reviews.title: Lots of bells and whistles
customer_reviews.text: Just got it about a week ago. So far so good. The watch band is very flexible (more so than the fitbit). It is also narrower so for me as a female is appreciated. The face is small but you can scroll through various widgets to record specific activities such as swimming or biking or climbing stairs without having to manually enter the information. The app is very easy to navigate. This product is one of the few that is accepted by my insurance as an activity tracker.
customer_reviews.author: Marion T.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty darn good little monitor!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is very picky. Went on a limb and got this for him as a gift and he loves it. He is used to wearing the same watch everyday and never takes it off but he has grown to love this. Although I'm a bit bummed I didnt get a protector on the screen bcuz he scratched it but it is a great little monitor. He is a big bike rider and loves tracking all his movements. I would recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Familyof4

customer_reviews.title: Perfect monitor for sleep & stress
customer_reviews.text: Love my garmin vivosmart! Got it to help me manage my sleep and insomnia issues and has been very helpful tracking the lack of deep sleep. It seems accurate for heart rate and my stress levels as well and the app is easy to use. Only wish it also checked blood pressure then it'd be perfect. But it's comfy, feminine to wear everyday and battery life so far is great.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah W.

customer_reviews.title: I love the stress indicator!
customer_reviews.text: So far has worked great and enduring the abuse it gets at my job (I'm a dog groomer so it encounters a ton of water and debris of all kinds all day). With the heart rate monitor and pulse-ox on I do have to charge multiple times a week usually a quick one mid week then I charge overnight one night. Great features on the app. I love the stress indicator. The only complaint I have is for some reason I can't get the notifications from my phone to stop. I'll go in and turn them off but I think what is happening is every time the Bluetooth disconnects and reconnects it resets the setting.
customer_reviews.author: Clarissa Pehrson

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Recommend! 👎👎👎👎👎
customer_reviews.text: I do NOT recommend the vivo 4. I’ve used the basic vivo for about 3 years now, and loved it, but it “died,” so I decided to upgrade to the vivosmart 4. I’ve been using it for about 6 days and several times is shows me in light or REM and/or both when I’m actually up and out of bed walking around! Additionally, in my travels today I climbed 12 flights of stairs and the vivo only shows 3! Seriously? Perhaps I have a faulty device, regardless, I do not recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Company support and length of functioning is lacking
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one after my first failed - a little over 2 years my other one broke the gold rim around the facing came off. Could not get it to sync, deleted app and re-installed (which I had done previously many times ) and it did not read nor did it tell time. Bought another as I cannot afford the better one....Their customer service is much to be desired. If you buy it....realize that you may only have one to two years of performance before you are forced to purchase another or find a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Engle

customer_reviews.title: Band is too short for me...and not replaceable
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to upgrade from a Vivofit 4 which I lost—somehow it slipped off my wrist and I was unaware until later in the day and couldn't find it. The Vivosmart 4 is a nice gadget with one fundamental flaw: the wrist strap is too small and, unlike the Vivofit, is not replaceable. Uncomfortable even on the last hole. Returned. Coughed up the extra money for a Series 3 Apple watch which has a comfortable band with plenty of room. I like Garmin products, but they made a big mistake in not making the band replaceable like the Vivofit. If your wrist is the right size you may like Vivosmart, otherwise look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Gylgayton

customer_reviews.title: Great for sleep tracking. Mediocre for everything else
customer_reviews.text: I tested this fitness device for two full days together with another 2 devices (and the smartphone too for step count). While the others were basically in line for heart rate and steps, this one was often exaggerating by 30 to 40 % - especially steps. The good feature instead is the sleep tracking. Well done the app and reasonably accurate the track. The device looks cool and light but accuracy is not among the best qualities. Returned
customer_reviews.author: mathmos69

customer_reviews.title: Super useful but...
customer_reviews.text: My first one died completely within 2 weeks... It took about 18 days to get my replacement which scratched the first time I put it on and now it's hard to read the screen... but aside from that - this is super useful if you're trying to loose weight or want to know more about your body stats on a day to day basic... The software (Garmin Connect) is awesome as well and this interfaces well with many 3rd party systems.
customer_reviews.author: ZachMac

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: Got for the pulse ox, but so much more to love! Is really motivating me to walk more. Gives me a goal that adjusts to my ability. The display lets you prioritize what you want to see and order according to your needs.
customer_reviews.author: linda v

customer_reviews.title: Good Replacement
customer_reviews.text: I had an old Vivofit. I liked it but the profile was quite large. It started to lose pixels, so I started looking for a replacement. It had to be able to be worn in the shower and pool. This fits the bill. Only thing that I dislike is that the band cannot be replaced. So my question to Garmin is, what do I do if this band breaks?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic seller. It arrived almost overnight, far faster than the shipping from competing watch models. Highly convenient for wearing, being light and small. Worse part is I'm not sure if the stats are accurate since I didn't have a second wearable checking them... which kind of makes me not sure if I'm benefitting from it. I don't think the app gave me any conclusions I didn't already know. The periodic hydration and get-moving! alerts were pretty nice.
customer_reviews.author: NeZeki

customer_reviews.title: Pulse Ox is wildly inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of the Garmin and it’s very comfortable. The app works well. The only issue that I have is that the pulse ox is wildly inaccurate, which is disappointing because that’s the reason I bought the watch.
customer_reviews.author: ICP

customer_reviews.title: Has so much potential
customer_reviews.text: My issues are with the bluetooth constantly disconnecting and reconnecting when I'm just a few feet from my phone. Also, the sleep tracking does not seem too accurate. It constantly shows me asleep at times when I was still awake so the hours slept are not correct. The app is nice and offers a lot of features. I like the size of the watch and the color. I will probably be looking for another option tho, since sleep tracking is important. It does a good job with the stress throughout the day, sending reminders to relax.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica L. Schafer

customer_reviews.title: Not for the scarred or tattooed.
customer_reviews.text: It was working great for the first week and then for some reason it will only work on un tattooed skin. Since my fiance is starting sleeves he has tattoos on both wrists. On one he doesn't have a tattoo under his wrist and it works fine there or his finger but put it on top of his wrist like we normally wear it and it won't work because of tattoo ink. Wish I had known this before I would have never recommend it for him.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Great activity tracker
customer_reviews.text: When the package arrived, Garmin had included the wrong charger for the band. I contacted Garmin support, sent them a photo of the charger they sent, and had a replacement within two days. Good Customer Service. I have an Amazfit T-rex watch that I use as my Smartwatch (time, date, stop watch, notifications, etc.) and then have the Vivosmart 4 as my activity/sleep/SPO2 tracker. I use Garmin Connect to link my Strava, and MyfitnessPal information into 1 location. Very happy with the band. Just be aware that it will count "steps" while brushing your teeth and won't count steps if your carrying something.
customer_reviews.author: Will C

customer_reviews.title: Watch features are great, and it's small, lightweight. Comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: This thing sucks for cycling. 100% don't lol. But, it's great at tracking sleep, and daily activity. Actually, the watch features are great, and it's small, lightweight. Comfortable. Prompts you to go for a walk, get a drink ... stretch, even to just stop and meditate a bit. The silent alarm feature is great ... it snags notifications from my android phone too which is cool if you're a task schedule sort of person.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas Price

customer_reviews.title: This thing is nuts
customer_reviews.text: It will tell you that you need to get up and moved after a 14 mile brisk walk or if your in a vehicle or a plane . It buzzes constantly for stupid things even if you have it on sleep mode. Is attractive and tells time but its stuck on military time can't find how to change it I'm not in the military I don't need all the things this is suppose to keep track of.
customer_reviews.author: Mary McGahuey

customer_reviews.title: Not very accurate
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the sleep tracking and O2 saturation. Very inaccurate O2 saturation readings. I can go from 90% to 100% when doing a manual reading with just the push of the button as a delay. Most of the time it just read 90%. I'm several % higher than this at the doctor's office.
customer_reviews.author: John J Feifel

customer_reviews.title: Only limited by its size
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered a different garmin but when receiving it, I realized I didn't want to wear anything that size on my wrist. I found the Vivosmart and liked it size. It does just about as much as the larger unit but the most important things to me are the pulse rate, steps and sleep monitoring. Satisfied with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: AZNorb

customer_reviews.title: This doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: This doesn’t work 1/2 the time. I’m wearing it correctly and snug and it only reads things 1/2 the time. Only tracked 3 out of the 10 hours I slept. None of the data is accurate because it’s only partial. Returned the next day for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: SaraO

customer_reviews.title: iPhone partial sync issues..
customer_reviews.text: Functionality works well but the problem is in sync with iPhone. All of a sudden it stops sync ing stress, body battery etc. There are a lot of people complaining about it in Garmin website and current work around is to reset the device without losing data. It’s annoyingly need to be done daily in my case. I’ll see if they update the firmware for a few days or else return it.
customer_reviews.author: SSS

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, looks great.
customer_reviews.text: I like the slim line it has on my wrist. It’s really easy to update with Garmin Connect. I printed out the instruction book when I first got it which is really easy to u defat and.
customer_reviews.author: ReaderWoman

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't do much well...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to track steps, SpO2/VO2 as well as heart rate. It doesn't do any of these very well. I realize it won't be perfect, but comparing heart rate to my heart rate strap the heart rate is 20-30 beats off consistently. Doesn't seem to track SpO2 well nor does the VO2 seem like it is right. Don't waste your money is my recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Monkeybones

customer_reviews.title: Small and Stylish.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch for my wife and she loves it. She likes that it is small and comfortable. The app is easy to use and easy to set up. She can read text messages, and track fitness. There is no GPS in this watch which she is fine with since I have GPS in my Instinct. We have noticed that the distance is off a little bit when compared to my GPS based Instinct, but it is pretty close so not a major concern.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Screen issues after 2 days use
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this device. Coming from a Fitbit inspire HR, the stats seem much more detailed and I like the Garmin app better. Unfortunately after 2 days of use this device developed some weird screen issues (I have never gotten water on it, even though it supposedly supports this). Now it’s very finicky to interact with and while reading notifications it does all sorts of weird visuals (see picture).
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

product_meta.title: Garmin 010-01995-10 Vivosmart 4, Activity and Fitness Tracker w/ Pulse Ox and Heart Rate Monitor, Midnight W/ Black Band, 0.75 Inches
product_meta.description: Color:Midnight w/ Black BandAccent your style while enhancing your fitness with our vivosmart 4 activity tracker. This slim, swim-friendly wearable comes loaded with fitness and wellness features to help you make the most of a healthier, more active lifestyle. It monitors heart rate estimates at the wrist and includes helpful tools such as all-day stress tracking, a relaxation breathing timer, Vo2 Max and activity timers for walks, runs, strength training, pool swims and more. A wrist-based pulse ox estimate sensor lets you check blood oxygen saturation anytime during the day -or turn it on while you sleep. Plus, body battery energy monitoring helps you know when you’re primed to be active or when you may need to rest. Safe for the pool or shower, vivosmart 4 keeps you going strong with up to 7 days of battery life (excluding pulse ox sleep tracking) -while smart notifications with vibration alerts help you stay connected on the go (When paired with a compatible smartphone).
feature_bullets: Slim, smart activity tracker blends fashionable design with stylish metal accents and a bright, easy to read display

Includes advanced sleep monitoring with REM sleep and can gauge blood oxygen saturation levels during the night with the wrist based Pulse Ox sensor. (Not a medical device and not intended for use in the diagnosis or monitoring of any medical condition)
Fitness and health monitoring tools include estimated wrist based heart rate, all day stress tracking, Relaxation breathing timer, Vo2 Max, body battery energy monitor and more
Features dedicated activity timers for walks, runs, strength training, yoga, pool swims and others; Lens material: Polycarbonate. Strap material: Silicone
Get vibration alerts for All notifications, including calls, text messages and more (text replies available for Android device users). Display resolution: 48 x 128 pixels
Battery life keeps up with you; Lasts up to 7 days (excluding pulse ox sleep tracking) and is safe for swimming and showering, too
Connect to your compatible smartphone’s GPS so you can get accurate tracking during outdoor walks and runs
